result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory D. Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With work release/huber and stayed until on or before 12/12/15, 6-7 a.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Letter from judge in response to DW-G's letter

Defendant Gregory D. Green in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  15CM176, 15CM170, 15TR1536, 15TR1537, 15TR1535 and 15TR1534.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution - def to plead to the charges in the two criminal cases for dismissal of the TR cases, 10 day jail on the CM170 case, and probation with conditions in the CM176 case.

Def pleads no contest to the 2 counts in 15CM176 and to the single count in 15CM170.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:

15CM170 - 10 days jail, stayed until on or before Dec. 12th between 6-7 a.m.  Pay costs.
15CM176 - sentence withheld for 18 months probation.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment or educational programs required by agent.  Pay costs.

Submit DNA sample at RCSD before leaving courthouse today.  Sign up for probation today.

4 TR cases dismissed.  

1 set of costs imposed - 15CM176.  No costs in 15CM170.  Costs as a condition of probation.

Defendant Gregory D. Green in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  6 cases called together:  adjourned initial in 15CM170 and 15CM176 and status in 15TR1534-1537.  Atty. M states that the parties are ready to proceed to disposition in this matter.  ADA states that victim/witness matters have not occurred; State needs more time.  Pleas taken in 15CM170 and 176.  In 176, Defense motions for and is granted reduction of the cash bail amount to $260.  Status in all requested and set for 11/6 at 2.  Clerk notes that bond was posted by GH.  The $240 will be refunded to that individual.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory D. Green in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together for initial appearance:  15CM170 and 15CM176.  Atty. M states she hasn't had a chance to review the complaint in 15CM176.  Both initials adjourned to Oct. 21 at 9.  15CM170 is already on the calendar for that date/time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bail/Bond Hearing Held this 11th Day of September 2015

AMENDED - Defendant may have contact with Diana L. Welsh while he is in jail.  No contact with Diana L. Welsh (DOB: 6/30/1961) when out of jail.  Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath 
or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.
This case was called with GG's bail hearing on 10-7-15 and the bond was amended, to allow contact with Diane Welsh only while def. is in jail.  Other conditions in bond remain.
